tn.text: Having just talked about the gifts that God gave to believers, Paul emphasizes what is more important.

Possible meanings are 1) Paul is exaggerating for the sake of effect and does not believe that people speak the language that angels use or 2) Paul thinks that some who speak in tongues actually speak the language that angels use. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: I have become a noisy gong or a clanging cymbal
tn.text: I have become like instruments that make loud, annoying sounds (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
a large, thin, round metal plate that is hit with a padded stick to make a loud sound (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
two thin, round metal plates that are hit together to make a loud sound (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: I give my body to be burned
tn.text: This can be made active. AT: "I allow those who persecute me to burn me to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Love is patient and kind ... endures all things
tn.text: Here Paul speaks about love as if it were a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one will be able to make it angry quickly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: It does not rejoice in unrighteousness. Instead, it rejoices in the truth
tn.text: "It rejoices only in righteousness and truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: For now we see indirectly in a mirror
tn.text: Mirrors in Paul's day were made of polished metal rather than glass and provided a dim, vague reflection.
Possible meanings are 1) "now we see Christ" or 2) "now we see God."
"but then we will see Christ face to face" This means that we will be physically present with Christ.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: just as I have been fully known
tn.text: This can be stated as active. AT: "just as Christ has known me fully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"It is important that ... now. It is important ... And it is important" (UDB)
"we trust in Christ, we are certain that he will do for us everything that he has promised, and we love him and each other"
